TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider extends System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider

Docs.summary: Enables Windows authentication with client application services.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use client application services to validate users by using Windows authentication. To enable Windows authentication, you configure your application to use the ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider class. For more information, see [How to: Configure Client Application Services](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
After configuration, you can validate users by calling the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. The <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method internally calls the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method automatically authenticates the current user and sets the `static` <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object that contains the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity>. If a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientRoleProvider> is configured for your application, you can use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object to retrieve user role information from the roles service.
You can retrieve a reference to the current ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider instance through the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.Provider%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. You can use the membership provider reference to call the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method directly. Additionally, you will need the membership provider reference to call the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.Logout%2A> method, which is not available in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider> base class.
## Examples The following example code demonstrates how to use this method to authenticate a user by using Windows authentication. In this example, the value of the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.Provider%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is cast to a ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider instance. This makes sure that a <xref:System.NullReferenceException> will be thrown if you accidentally test this code by using another membership provider.
[!code-vb[ClientApplicationServices#309](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/ClientAppServicesDemo/Class1.vb#309)] [!code-cs[ClientApplicationServices#309](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ClientAppServicesDemo/Class1.cs#309)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Logout ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Logout() cil managed

Docs.summary: Logs out the user.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For users authenticated through client application services, the `static` <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object that enables access to the configured role service. The Logout method resets the <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A> property to a <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal> object that contains the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity>. After you call this method, you can no longer retrieve roles for the user through the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientRoleProvider> class. To reauthenticate the current user, call the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
## Examples The following example code demonstrates how to use this method to log out the user.
[!code-vb[ClientApplicationServices#310](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/ClientAppServicesDemo/Class1.vb#310)] [!code-cs[ClientApplicationServices#310](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ClientAppServicesDemo/Class1.cs#310)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool ValidateUser (string username, string password);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool ValidateUser(string username, string password) cil managed

Docs.summary: Automatically authenticates the current user by using the identity supplied by the operating system.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you configure your application to use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientWindowsAuthenticationMembershipProvider> class, the `static` <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method will use this method for its implementation. The ValidateUser method automatically authenticates the current user and sets the `static` <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object that contains the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity>. If a <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.Providers.ClientRoleProvider> is configured for your application, you can use the <xref:System.Web.ClientServices.ClientRolePrincipal> object to retrieve user role information from the roles service.
## Examples The following example code demonstrates how to use this method to authenticate a user by using Windows authentication.
[!code-vb[ClientApplicationServices#309](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/ClientAppServicesDemo/Class1.vb#309)] [!code-cs[ClientApplicationServices#309](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ClientAppServicesDemo/Class1.cs#309)]
